TopicTitle: Duna Constellation mission pack. First V.10 rebuild craft pics (Altair lander)

Articles.Content:
Okey dokey,

I have started work on the rebuild. I'm working on the landers first before 1.0 arrives. I'm aiming for something close to this:

My hab lander will have a central part that can be rotated outwards to give the same look as the inflatable hab in the video below.

All craft are, and will continue to be based on the cancelled reference mission animation video. You can watch it here to give you an idea of what to expect:

This may take a while!

MJ

Sorry! Here you go

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I really like the general shape of this lander though it's carrying capacity isn't high. You can't easily land it on Kerbin because of the wing on the top but it would work fine on Duna or atmosphere-less planets. This is more like a concept of using wings for the back of the lander for a more smoothed out shape then a constellation lander as it doesn't have the complete oblong and wire frame shape that the constellation lander has. I'm a fan of the shape though and I hope it gives you some good ideas.

.craft (Dropbox) if you need it.

For single use deployable ramps, i think i might have something lightweight and low part count which might help, if you need (and that can dock after deployment) - currentky experimenting those with my current project - those extremely small hinges are perfect for those jobs (basically, a single use non redocking ramp will use around 5 or 7 parts besides the ramp itself. (For the hinges weight, you'll have a decoupler, and two LV1-Rs - the rest is massless )

For single use deployable ramps, i think i might have something lightweight and low part count which might help, if you need (and that can dock after deployment) - currentky experimenting those with my current project - those extremely small hinges are perfect for those jobs (basically, a single use non redocking ramp will use around 5 or 7 parts besides the ramp itself. (For the hinges weight, you'll have a decoupler, and two LV1-Rs - the rest is massless )

That's mighty nice of you to say mate. I am working hard on the rebuild! And if you liked the original your gunna love the new one!

Ok a quick update on the rebuild.

The landers are 95% complete now and looking awesome. They are very close in shape to the proposed landers in the reference mission video.

They each have one SPR (rover) now a two kerbal rover. They also have the DIPS powercart placed as in the video (on the forward ramp) which lowers to the ground once you land. This ramp also allows the SPR to drive out.

And the FSPS which is towed by the DIPS powercart. It is also placed correctly on my landers (the rear ramp) Which also lowers when you land.

The real proposed hab lander has an inflatable hab that extends athwart of the lander on the port side. I have recreated this by building the hab lander with a large space in the belly to hold a hitchhiker which can be lowered and then driven free of the lander to dock to a port side adapter mimicking the inflatable hab of the real lander.

As the landers have an unprecedented level of detail (for a stock constellation mission) the part count has gone up a little. Although the overall count of all the craft will be lower. This is even after reducing the part count of the SPR from 95 to 45. Given how they look it is totally worth it!

This is a no compromise, as accurate as possible replica.

All that's left now is to rebuild all the launchers. I had a look at the Copernicus transfer vehicle and reduced the part count from around 500 to around 200. This will make the burn to Duna much easier and the subsequent docking with the lander in Duna orbit.

I just have to wait for version 1.0 now. I'm sure you guys are going to love it!

MJ
